page.title: 17Sport in Stevington
page.content: The village has a well-kept playing field which is used mainly by the men for football in winter and cricket in summer.Two football pitches are marked out and junior and senior teams play regular matches.In summer the cricket square is carefully tended.The cricket club has put up its own spacious pavilion at the top of the field.The ladies have on occasion used the field for rounders matches and netball practices.People interested in tennis,squash,badminton,golf or swimming have to travel to facilities outside the area.There is however a privately owned tennis court available to some.The flourishing table tennis club uses the Village Hall for its matches.Friends of landowners get some pigeon and rabbit shooting and fishing.Indoor games such as darts and pool are played in the public houses.
